page.title: 19Wildlife
page.content: Apart from farms and the river, this area consists mainly of{chalk hillside and{deciduous woodland.}Many of the trees have been planted, some to lead as avenues to the estates. Such trees are Lime, Beech and Horse-Chestnut. Much of the woodland was{coppiced} in the past and here are Hazel, Ash, Oak and a variety of shrubs such as Dog Rose. Bluebells carpet some of the woods in Spring. The larger mammals like badgers and foxes take cover in the woods, but emerge to feed or to hunt in the fields, where rabbits and hares can also be seen. Small mammals provide abundant food for birds of prey such as the Kestrel, Buzzard and Sparrowhawk. The summer flowers on the hills are many and varied. They include bedstraws, Pyramidal Orchid, poppies, knapweeds, Scabious, Cowslip and Yellow Toadflax.
